name: NuGetPackager
description: Creates nupkg outputs from csproj or nuspec files
author: Lawrence Gripper

inputs.name: searchPattern
inputs.label: Path to csproj or nuspec file(s) to pack
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pattern to search for csproj or nuspec files to pack.

inputs.name: includeReferencedProjects
inputs.label: Include referenced projects
inputs.helpMarkDown: Include referenced projects either as dependencies or as part of the package. If a referenced project has a corresponding nuspec file that has the same name as the project, then that referenced project is added as a dependency. Otherwise, the referenced project is added as part of the package. [Learn more](http://docs.nuget.org/consume/command-line-reference#pack-command) at NuGet.org.

inputs.name: outputdir
inputs.label: Package Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder where packages will be created. If empty, packages will be created alongside the csproj or nuspec file.

inputs.name: versionByBuild
inputs.label: Automatic package versioning
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If you choose 'Use the date and time', this will generate a [SemVer](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)-compliant version formatted as `X.Y.Z-ci-datetime` where you choose X, Y, and Z.

If you choose 'Use an environment variable', you must select an environment variable and ensure it contains the version number you want to use.

If you choose 'Use the build number', this will use the build number to version you package. **Note:** Under General set the build format to be '[$(BuildDefinitionName)_$(Year:yyyy).$(Month).$(DayOfMonth)$(Rev:.r)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=627416)'.

inputs.name: versionEnvVar
inputs.label: Environment variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the variable name without $, $env, or %.

inputs.name: configurationToPack
inputs.label: Configuration to Package
inputs.helpMarkDown: When using a csproj file this specifies the configuration to package

inputs.name: buildProperties
inputs.label: Additional build properties
inputs.helpMarkDown: Semicolon delimited list of properties used to build the package.

inputs.name: nuGetAdditionalArgs
inputs.label: NuGet Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to NuGet.exe pack. [More Information](https://docs.nuget.org/consume/command-line-reference#user-content-pack-command).

inputs.name: nuGetPath
inputs.label: Path to NuGet.exe
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the path to NuGet.exe
